Package org.hypermedea.op

Interface Operation

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseOperation, DeleteFileOperation, FileOperation, HttpOperation, ReadFileOperation, WriteFileOperation
public interface Operation
A Web operation is a temporal entity (~time interval) that starts with a request sent by the client to the server and that remains active as long as the server returns responses. A server is e.g. expected to return a single response during an HTTP GET operation and several responses during a CoAP OBSERVE operation.

  • Method Details

    • getTargetURI

      String getTargetURI()
      Return the URI of the resource targeted in the operation.
      Returns:
      URI of the operation's target resource

    • getForm

      Map<String,Object> getForm()
      Return the filled-out form passed as argument to the instantiation of the operation. A form is a collection of key-value pairs (fields) that parameterize the request sent to initiate the operation.
      Returns:
      a form

    • getPayload

      Collection<jason.asSyntax.Literal> getPayload()
      Return the request's payload, as one or more Jason literals.
      Returns:
      the currently set payload

    • setPayload

      void setPayload(jason.asSyntax.Literal payload)
      Fill out the form with a payload. Convenience method for setPayload(Collection) if the collection is a singleton.
      Parameters:
      payload - payload to send to the server

    • setPayload

      void setPayload(Collection<jason.asSyntax.Literal> payload)
      Fill out the form with a payload. The server may reject it and return CLIENT_ERROR status.
      Parameters:
      payload - payload to send to the server

    • sendRequest

      void sendRequest() throws OperationAlreadyStartedException, IOException

      Start the operation by sending a message to the server with payload. When the method returns, the client may assume the request was received by the server. This doesn't imply that the server already responded, though. To synchronously wait for a response, use getResponse().

      An operation is supposed to include only one request. An exception must be raised if multiple requests are sent within the same operation.

      Throws:
      OperationAlreadyStartedException - if the caller attempts to send more than one request
      IOException - if connection to the server is lost or if the request is never received by the server

    • getResponse

      Response getResponse() throws NoResponseException
      Wait synchronously for a response from the server and return it. If the method is called after the server responded, it immediately returns the cached response.
      Returns:
      the unique response sent by the server
      Throws:
      NoResponseException - if no response has been received after some timeout or if connection to the server was lost

    • registerResponseCallback

      void registerResponseCallback(ResponseCallback callback)
      Register a callback for asynchronous responses sent by the server.
      Parameters:
      callback - response callback exposing a method with a Response as argument

    • unregisterResponseCallback

      void unregisterResponseCallback(ResponseCallback callback)

      Remove a callback from the list of registered callbacks for the operation.

      If no callback is registered, the operation should end (and connection with the server may be dropped). Any subsequent call to the operation's methods should raise an error.

      Parameters:
      callback - response callback already registered via registerResponseCallback(ResponseCallback)
